website_summaries.verdict: Delivers the heavy-duty shredding and chipping of gas-powered products without the fumes and maintenance.
pros: Well-built, heavy duty leaf shredder and chipper
Starts instantly and is less expensive to maintain than gas-powered shredders
cons: Less powerful than gas-powered shredders, meaning wet leaves can be problematic
Large limbs and leaf piles must be fed slowly to avoid tripping the circuit breaker
Clogs can take time and effort to clear

website_summaries.verdict: One of the most powerful electric wood chippers on our shortlist — and also one of the most expensive.
pros: Includes baffles and safety goggles for extra protection

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered. Overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: Very underpowered. Stalls out very easily and then stops working. Must wait 15 minutes to cool down to reset the motor. Can't cut close to 2.5 inches. 2 inch if lucky. Needs a stronger motor and two cutting knives. Only has one knife. It is also way overpriced. I would not recommend. I found a $99 chipper with 2 knives. It almost does better than this $1100 plus chipper. I would be happy with this chipper if I had paid less than $300. I feel I got ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Sam G.

customer_reviews.title: A real disappointment. It jams constantly.
customer_reviews.text: This looks like a serious chipper-shredder, but it's not. It's light duty and jams constantly. Honestly, I end up spending more time trying to get the darned thing unjammed than I can spend actually using it. If all you've got are some loose dry leaves and a few small freshly cut branches, you'll be okay. But it jams on just about anything else. And it's not easy to get it working again. I've wasted hours that could have been better spent.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Alan Isaacson

customer_reviews.title: Would give it 10 stars
customer_reviews.text: WOW - after 2 winter storms and lots of yard debris and one burned out chipper I finally decided to ‘invest’ in a real (heavy) one. Delivered last night (thank you UPS specialist for your great service!), assembled this morning and then, I just wanted to try it out quickly; nope - I couldn’t stop until everything was gone in record time. Patriot Products says you can return it within 90 days - NO WAY, not gonna happen...
customer_reviews.author: AlexanderTea

customer_reviews.title: Not "Quiet" and can jamb up.
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, it is not. You will need to wear hearing protection. It does work very well and we really think we made a good choice in purchasing this product. But, the reason for 4 stars: 1. It seems to clog up easily it you try to grind up green leaves and you usually have to physically dig the debris out the the discharge shoot. 2. Branches get wedged in-between the flywheel/cutting blade and the housing such that you have to take a vise-grip wrench to clamp onto the shaft and forcibly turn the flywheel to dislodge the offending branch.
customer_reviews.author: Birch-Creek Seattle

customer_reviews.title: This works great and seems very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This works great and seems very sturdy. The only issue is you have to not over feed and watch the chute where the mulched items exit. If the bag get full and you don't notice it gets clogged big time. Happened to me twice the first day and I spent 20-30 minutes getting it cleared. As long as that doesn't happen it works fine. My mother in law has a Sears gas model and it works better but it's very noisey, hard to start and extremely heavy. Over all the electric works well for my smaller yard needs.
customer_reviews.author: Brad S. Evans

customer_reviews.title: this actually works
customer_reviews.text: I like doing my own yard work. I have forsythia, mulberry and other shrubs that get pruned yearly, creating piles of small branches. For years I have been shredding leaves for compost, and I have been irked that I can't compost these branches. I didn't want to have to deal with a gasoline powered chipper. This chipper went together easily with the step by step instructions. I advise reading the instructions. Works great with the size branches I'm generating.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly's Creek

customer_reviews.title: ... as I am very busy But this chipper is great! It's electric so theres no fumes
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually post reviews on Amazon as I am very busy But this chipper is great! It's electric so theres no fumes,quiet enough that my neighbors don't mind and I'm really close.It is powerful enough for me, I have shredded branches up to Two inches no problem and bags of leaves you need to take your time though ! don't just stuff them in or you will jam it! It make a really fine mulch for compost! The customer service is amazing,I had a question when I was assembling it and the owner of the company stayed on the phone for over twenty minutes talking me through it! try that with a chinese manufacturer1
customer_reviews.author: Tom D

customer_reviews.title: works as expected...thanks for making an electric chipper that handles most wood and brush
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with this chipper. I have about 3/4 of an acre with lots of older overgrowth that I'm trimming and removing. I love that I own a chipper so I can do whatever I have time and energy for that day and not worry about renting and returning. I also love that I can just plug it in and go for it...no gas or oil maintenance (I already had a 20 amp circuit by my air conditioner in my backyard). If you follow the instructions and have your expectations set appropriately (this isn't for huge or heavy-duty applications) you should be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: K. Werner

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Efficient Chipper
customer_reviews.text: We've used it 5 years now and it still works well. We generally only need to use it one or two days a year but our son-in-law borrowed it once to chop up tree limbs and had no problems with it. The machine does a great job chipping and shredding yard waste to produce compost material and it's nice not to have to deal with gasoline, oil, and engine maintenance. It does tend to pop the house electric breaker occasionally but only if we run something else simultaneously on the same line - and that could be due to a weak breaker. If you want a quiet, efficient chipper/shredder then this one is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Frank N. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Chipper
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint is that the upper shoot clogs too easily if you put a fairly small amount of leaves in it, causing them not to reach the blades. It takes a little getting used to. Other than that, it's quite impressive what it can chip. It's going to take care of at least 95% of my yard waste.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E Bajoras

customer_reviews.title: It works fine as long as you have thin straight branches to ...
customer_reviews.text: It works fine as long as you have thin straight branches to chew. Does not work for entangled branches like live oak.
customer_reviews.author: AboveClouds

customer_reviews.title: Super chipper & shredder!
customer_reviews.text: Makes short work of brush & branches. I get a lot of droppings from Giant Sequoia & Coast Redwood trees all year long. I call my Patriot 'The Beast' because it is loud, beefy, & processes everything, leaving beautiful mulch that I use all over my 1/3rd acre. How nice NOT to have to pay for mulch or wood chips. Thanks so much for such a great chipper/shredder!
customer_reviews.author: Sandbar

customer_reviews.title: I love my Patriot
customer_reviews.text: I love my Patriot. It is very well-built, solidly constructed and comfortable to use. Although it has a heavy motor, as a small woman I can easily move it on its wheels around my garden. It is, of course, essential to read the manual/operating instructions and learn to feed the hopper properly. That done, this chipper/shredder will efficiently handle large amounts of leaves, garden cuttings and small branches, without jamming. As an avid gardener and composter, I am delighted to return all shredded organic material to my garden. No more paper bags, town pickups or waste! This year I'm treating myself to the vacuum attachment to make fall clean up even faster. I recommend this product without reservations.
customer_reviews.author: ennaoj

customer_reviews.title: Wish I hadn't Bought this.
customer_reviews.text: $1000 when I purchased Stalls out and short circuits constantly. Get a gas one.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: and it's perfect. I chose this over one of the lighter ...
customer_reviews.text: Have had mine for about 5months. Had the usual issues with overloading 15amp circuit, but got around that with extension cord to garage 20amp plug, then routed a new outdoor line; and with clogging, but none since I've started feeding stuff in more slowly rather than just piling it in. So-new outlet, slower feed, and it's perfect. I chose this over one of the lighter duty string shredders, and am glad I did. Leaves and pinestraw come out great for composting. It easily handles 2 inch limbs, and chips are great for mulching.
customer_reviews.author: chomey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shredder - was on the fence for months, wish I had bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Would give it six stars if I could! I've used a few electric shredders and they were not in the same league as this one. It's still possible to overload it but it operates much better than anything but a good sized gas powered unit. I've mulched all my tree beds from the fall leaves we get in CT and have shredded hundreds of feet of branches from an 80 foot tree that feel in the back yard. The company is also great - the instructions have a bit of a sense of humor and it's incredibly well made.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Grant

customer_reviews.title: A very good wood shredder and chipper.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good shredder/chipper with a powerful electric motor. It is relatively easy to use. You have to be careful not to feed material too quickly as it has a tendency to jam if there is too much stuff in the top hopper. The chipper works well for branches up to 1.5 inches. You need to use the bag for output; otherwise it flies all over the place. The bag is a little tricky to attach, but works well once you have it correctly in place.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen F. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. Jammed it the first time I ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Jammed it the first time I used it. Operator error: needs to be fed slowly. Not nearly as noisy as the gas version.
customer_reviews.author: jcm5683

customer_reviews.title: ... and we've chipped a lot of cedar branches into wonderful mulch. It doesn't handle branches as large as ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a workhorse and we've chipped a lot of cedar branches into wonderful mulch. It doesn't handle branches as large as advertised so I will still be burning some but not nearly as much as when I didn't have the ability to make mulch! My trees are happier to have new revetements and cedar mulch!
customer_reviews.author: shelley Rubinstein

customer_reviews.title: Great product for properties with a lot of trees and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product for properties with a lot of trees and bushes. Last spring we trimmed down a 40 ft. long hedgerow from 20 ft. high to 4 ft. All of the green trimmings (up to 1-1/2" diameter) went through this powerful trimmer without problem. This has been my wife's favorite yard tool for the last year and she mulches her various gardens with the clippings. This product is well designed and simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: John Pebley

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised - love it!
customer_reviews.text: It took a bit for me figure out how to put this one together. The instructions with pictures are not that great. It helps if you have a natural ability to put things together. I love that this does so much and runs on electricity. No smelly gas fumes and running it out of fuel when I am done. Just do some minor cleaning and roll it into its storage spot. It took me a couple uses to figure out the proper feed rate. I haven't used it long enough yet to need to sharpen the blades but the instructions are very clear so I don't foresee an issue there.
customer_reviews.author: DianeN

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for keeping your yard neat!
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 1/4 acres, hundreds of trees that need trimming or that "self" trim. Before we got this trimmer, we would build a pile of debris big enough to warrant paying for haul away. No more. This machine is amazing. As long as you respect its size limitations and power needs, you will have no problem with it. We have easily saved the purchase price and would not be without it!
customer_reviews.author: Annee2012

customer_reviews.title: Eats yard waste without alienating the neighbors.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an ancient, noisy, gas-powered chipper-shredder that was more than I needed. I really like this Patriot electric unit. I jammed it a few times until I learned how to feed it properly, but now it's easy to use. I've shredded many bags of leaves into perfect mulch material. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: N King

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Patriot Electric Chipper in 2013 and have been very satisfied with its performance. We have a half acre wooded lot, and we frequently are chipping branches and other small saplings. This is a perfect product for home owners with significant need for chipping and shredding. The chipping makes excellent mulch for our garden and outdoor beds.
customer_reviews.author: John Will

customer_reviews.title: Electric chipper works wonders!
customer_reviews.text: I find that it is so easy to use the electric chipper since I have used gas choppers before that were noisier and hard to start. I have a lake side wooded lot and have landscaping needs that are satisfied with this easy to use electric chipper. I am extremely satisfied at the ease of sharpening the chipper blade. With the death of our scotch pines I have a multitude of branches to grind up into mulch for landscaping the property. I have had years of use so far!
customer_reviews.author: Sanford E. Pomerantz

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Well built. Uses every bit of a 20amp circuit. Doesn't like wet stuff. Will grind up the big branches but don't force them. Turns dry leaves to powder for great mulch. Remember to wash out after use.
customer_reviews.author: JimC

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Pretty weak. Branches and leaves must be very dry or it chokes. I'm pretty disappointed with it.
customer_reviews.author: D Rode

customer_reviews.title: ... it this weekend for the first time Chipped Bamboo like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I used it this weekend for the first time Chipped Bamboo like a dream. Need to be feed slowly to prevent clogs.. Overall very happy with the chipper.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: ... had my Patriot Chipper 2 seasons now and I love it. I compost my yard refuse and this ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Patriot Chipper 2 seasons now and I love it. I compost my yard refuse and this chipper processes my yard waste into a perfect blend for my compost piles. It is very well built and has performed well beyond my expectations. I didn't want another gas engine to maintain but was worried the electric motor wouldn't be up to the task. The power is more than ample for my needs and this chipper has handled everything I have put through it. I highly recommend this chipper and am happy an American built product is so well designed and manufactured. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Pompey

customer_reviews.title: Well made. Works like a champ.
customer_reviews.text: My property after one month looks so amazing with all the dead material mulched and chipped. Well made machine. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Upson Downs

customer_reviews.title: ... Amp Electric Wood Chipper/Leaf Shredder (Lawn & Patio) A great chipper and shredder
customer_reviews.text: Patriot Products CSV-2515 14 Amp Electric Wood Chipper/Leaf Shredder (Lawn & Patio) A great chipper and shredder. chips branches and leafs to smaa sizes, the unit is fine for my one acre yard, I can't compare it to any gas engine models, but this chipper does the job for me. very strong, easy to handle and relocate, no pollution, lower decibels, nothing to complain about at all. I recommended highly! I also recommend safety glasses. Only problem during overloading. When the unit is jammed it can be freed up in time, and the unit does what they it will do. I'm a happy chipper.
customer_reviews.author: Abe

customer_reviews.title: It runs much quieter than gas powered chipper. No ...
customer_reviews.text: It runs much quieter than gas powered chipper. No problem with power. It ate up a 2" limb of a fig tree in a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shredder
customer_reviews.text: This works great for shredding leaves and small twigs in my Colorado yard. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jroz

customer_reviews.title: Best electric chipper
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup. Shredder works well if fed slowly and with the cover flap removed. Chipper worked well with branches up to 1.5 inches. It easily chipped cottonwood, pecan and hackberry. It struggles with cedar. Oak was way to hard for it too chip efficiently. If you push the chipper too hard it will trip the circuit breaker, a minor inconvenience. Changing the blade was simple. Recommend to buy an extra blade for rotation and a sharpening stone. Overall the unit works well for a 1-2 acre yard. Think it could benefit from a heavier fly wheel. I especially like that it is electric with very little maintainence.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Purchase of the Patriot Electric Chipper
customer_reviews.text: We love this Patriot chipper. We wanted something just for leaves and small branches for my compost bin. It was easy to assemble and is very easy to operate. We feed the debris into the chipper at an even feed and have had no jamming. Also light enough to easily move from one location to another. The leaves shred to about one tenth their size which will work out great for mulch and compost. And it's made in the USA!!! We did purchase the 100 foot cord sold by the manufacturer, and we believe that was a very good investment as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Baitz

customer_reviews.title: Electric Patriot Chipper review
customer_reviews.text: I love my Electric Patriot Chipper/Leaf Shredder. It is quite powerful - there are no stinky gas fumes. I have used it a lot over about a year and I really don't have a complaint. It uses every bit of the 14 amps as it chips through limbs. I use up to about 2" limbs. It likes hard wood versus soft, spongy wood like live willow branches, but that is true for all chippers that I have used. I would definitely recommend this chipper as part of your gardening supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Miller

customer_reviews.title: Patriot Products CSV-2515 14 Amp Electric Wood Chipper/Leaf Shredder
customer_reviews.text: Would be nice if the manufacturer replaced the nuts, for the chipper chute, with wing nuts. Due to space limitations, I have to remove the chute with each use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Hauck

customer_reviews.title: Electric, not gasoline chipper
customer_reviews.text: Works great at chipping small to medium sized limbs. It does get clogged or throws a breaker every once in a while, but usually due to operator error. Don't expect it to be a gas powered chipper, and you will love this. BY that I mean while it may not have the power of gasoline, it is frustration free and great for the once every few months user.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer Sooner

customer_reviews.title: use in moderation - it sounds like a Cessna taking off
customer_reviews.text: Very important to have it on a high-capacity circuit, because it draws every bit as much as they say. But I've had two strenuous sessions with it, and it crunches everything as advertised. If the neighbors are close, use in moderation - it sounds like a Cessna taking off.
customer_reviews.author: RossDave

customer_reviews.title: Won't handle anything that is too much like a vine but all in all in grinds up ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product for light clean-up for small bushes and shrubs. It works very well. Won't handle anything that is too much like a vine but all in all in grinds up what we need and then we use the chips to mulch the beds. Would certainly recommend this for light work.
customer_reviews.author: Rose T

customer_reviews.title: Not enough power
customer_reviews.text: The build quality seems to be very good but the electric motor just is not strong enough over heats too much and have to wait for it to cool down to reset. I think this chipper would work great with a stronger motor
customer_reviews.author: Robert Neinast

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I love this wood chipper/shredder. It's sturdy enough and powerful enough to handle everything I threw at it. As long as I fed materials in at a reasonably steady rate and didn't try to force the materials in, it did a great job and never clogged or shut down - even with green materials. And when I re-fed the chipped materials through the shredder, it reduced the time necessary to turn the materials into compost. Some of the reviews made me hesitate to buy this shredder, but now that I've used it I can't imagine why those reviewers had problems (except the guy who had problems feeding branches through the top hopper - they go in the side cone).
customer_reviews.author: An Old Baby Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Patriot CSV-2515 Chipper/Shredder
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job on tree limbs and leaves. Even if you are not using the chipped limbs for mulch the reduction in volume is amazing. Well built and designed to be user maintainable. Has only clogged when I let the bag get full or tried to feed shrubbery that was still wet - user error.
customer_reviews.author: Maxine R. Flythe

customer_reviews.title: Purchased in 2012. Replaced a 9 horse gas powered ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 2012. Replaced a 9 horse gas powered chipper/shredder. No trouble starting in cold weather.. No dealing with gas or fouled carburetor. . Works very well creating mulch to use around a residential yard with lots of mature trees and hedges.
customer_reviews.author: Realist

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy to assemble and well packed to ship. When I turned it on the unit blew out packaging foam an the seized up. I call customer service and he was a bit arrogant and condescending as I explained the issue. I get these calls all the time he stated. Great then you have a problem. He gave me a few suggestions on what to do and it worked. However what fell out was a plastic packaging corner. Very strange. Company did not seem too interested. again great product sub standard customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond J. Canzanese

customer_reviews.title: Used once so far, but it is excellent!
customer_reviews.text: It's been very wet on Long Island this summer so I haven't had too much time with good, dry conditions. The only time I used the Patriot, it worked very well and is very quiet! I recommend using the bag to catch the chips because the pieces come flying out and then require rake and shovel to collect. Assembly not too bad. Seems solid. The motor seems very capable for the job. Did not jam over a 2 hour work load and never tripped my circuit (I used a 12 gauge cord 100ft). I used gloves, safety googles and ear protection. One branch end flew out the feed tube, so protecting your hands, face, and eyes is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Ed in Huntington NY

customer_reviews.title: Watch the wet/green stuff
customer_reviews.text: This is about as good as an 110 volt electric unit can get, really chips branches to ground cover size without stalling, just make sure you feed it at a reasonable rate. One tip, it can build up a potential clog when feeding really green/wet stuff, like trimmings or leaves, so I let that stuff dry a couple of days and then it has no problem.
customer_reviews.author: holson

customer_reviews.title: Had one clog and it was relatively easy to remedy with a little disassembly and a hose
customer_reviews.text: Had a gas powered model which was difficult to start at times. This machine works well. Had one clog and it was relatively easy to remedy with a little disassembly and a hose. Plenty of power for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Mills

customer_reviews.title: Just about the only reasonable electric chipper available
customer_reviews.text: I tried other small electric chippers. I wanted electric because the gas ones seem to beat themselves to death and I wanted less noise and smell and maintenance. I am very happy with this chipper. It is naturally not as powerful as a gas one, but that is to be expected with a 120 volt power supply. Once you get the hang of it, it is pretty easy not to trip the breaker, especially if you're not trying to chip dry logs. I wonder if I could upgrade to a 240 volt motor.
customer_reviews.author: Solomon Parker

customer_reviews.title: Impressive equipment
customer_reviews.text: This equipment is very well built and works flawlessly. The electric motor is industrial strength! Assembly is easy following the directions. All you really need to do is fasten the hopper and the feed funnel. All of the mechanical parts are completely assembled and ready to go. Eye protection is included. Consider getting the "Chipper Buddy" . Basically it is a ramrod designed so you cannot hit any of the cutting blades.
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: Works well for brush and yard waste. Follow instructions as to what to put in ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the shredder earlier this year and finally got a chance to assemble and use it. Works well for brush and yard waste. Follow instructions as to what to put in and you will do fine. Looking forward to mulching my fall gardens with the chipped brush.
customer_reviews.author: KATHRYN S.

customer_reviews.title: The assembly instructions could have been better but typical from my experience
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product every couple of months for over 2 years. The chipper works as advertised. Be sure to use an appropriately rated extension cord or you will be tripping your AC supply breaker. The assembly instructions could have been better but typical from my experience.
customer_reviews.author: bill varn

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer
customer_reviews.text: Have used the chipper for 2.5 years so far and have had no problems whatsoever. It produces a bag full of chips relatively quickly. While it is loud, it is much quieter than my neighbors' chippers. This machine is built to last.
customer_reviews.author: D.L.

customer_reviews.title: Patriot shredder, electric
customer_reviews.text: The shredder needs to be assembled, which is relatively easy. Only one spot can be tricky because of limited space, big hand may not fit between the parts to insert the screws. All else is simple. When running the unit be careful not to create a kink in the bag catching the chips, this will create a back log, clogging the outlet and the fuse will fly out. If it happens, the in-fill chute must be removed and the sawdust and chips removed using a piece of wire. Karl, Ithaca NY
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Patriot Performs
customer_reviews.text: Patriot does the job intended for it. Only problems are due to operator failure, i.e. overloading. When the unit is jammed it can be freed up in time. Follow instructions and the unit does what they it will do. I'm a happy chipper.
customer_reviews.author: GLENN DAVIS

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in good order and have been very pleased in using it. Not made for big pieces of wood but works very well for small branches and vines ---I have a lot of both. Much quieter than I expected. Seems very well built and designed to take tough jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly sized for cleaning up the flower beds ... makes quick work of getting everything down to size for the compost pile.
customer_reviews.author: m. hill

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning up my willow trees
customer_reviews.text: Ideal for small to moderate properties. Great for cleaning up my willow trees, but not so good with pine tree debris; sap tends to clog the blades.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Kuhr

customer_reviews.title: Like some other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: I got this last Summer, and used it a lot-maybe 60 or 70 full baqs. It will get more workout this Fall. Like some other reviewers, I find that the chipper tube works great if you are reasonable about the size of pieces you feed it. Fresh cut branches work better than old dead and dry stuff. The shredder requires fairly slow and careful feeding to avoid jams and clogs. You can't just dump a basket of leaves into the hopper. If you don't push it too hard it works fine. Both chipper and shredder chop things up very nicely into excellent size for mulch. The machine is solid and well made, and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: It works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for 3 years. It works like a charm. Love the electric motor: no hassle start, no oil change, just plug it in and turn it on. I have recommended it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Great home chipper
customer_reviews.text: The blades must be kept very sharp with a grinder to chip wood well. The thermal cutoff protects you from damaging the motor. The wood chips it makes are small with a sharp blade and are ideal for mulching.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Does everyhing it said it would
customer_reviews.text: Needed a chipper for the house to get rid of the shrub piles building up around the property. Price was steep but I wanted it to be quality. I did not want another gas engine to fight to get running every spring. Spent two days feeding it and was very impressed. Up to two inches with a tempered feed. Very Easy to get used to adjusting the feed rate from the sound of the motor. Girlfriend not afraid of it. She wheels it out and uses it without me there all the time. It is what it is, but it does what it said it would! Happy with the purchase. No negatives yet.
customer_reviews.author: ELaffin

customer_reviews.title: For an occasional user it is much better than one with gas motor as is starts with ...
customer_reviews.text: The Patriot Electric Chipper/Shredder is high quality. For an occasional user it is much better than one with gas motor as is starts with the flip of a switch. It is more than adequate for your routine yard cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Schulze

customer_reviews.title: Nice electric chipper. Great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly powerful chipper considering that it is electric. Not too noisy. Easily chips up to about 1 and 1/4" branches. Bogs down a little at 1 and 1/2". Recovers well once you slow down on the feed. I would definitely buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: WindJeep

customer_reviews.title: gets stuck on anything of any girth. Pain in ...
customer_reviews.text: gets stuck on anything of any girth. Pain in the rear to unclog. ughhhh Not powerful enough. If you just want to pulverize small plants and tiny branches it's ok, but even those created a need to unclog the entry.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: I occasionally chip / shred, and did not want the maintenance associated with a gas powered unit. This has worked out well. It does have the limitation of needing to have an electrical connection, but for the amount of chipping / shredding I do, I am content with wheeling a brush pile to this unit for chipping; this is not an issue for the average sized lot, as long extension cords can stretch to the property boundaries.
customer_reviews.author: gardener

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Have used mulcher for leaves so far and it works very well. Cleaned up my yard in a few hours. Have not tried chipper for wood yet, but hope it works as well. Really like not having to start a gasoline engine.
customer_reviews.author: BATH

customer_reviews.title: Patriot Chipper Shredder
customer_reviews.text: The top hopper pinches down to a very small opening before the leaves and any TINY branches can enter the mechanism. Just look at the picture of the top black chute. Feeding down through the top quickly causes a jamb. The directions state that branches 1/2 inch diameter and less can be feed in the top chute. Don't try it, leaves alone cause a jamb and it quickly becomes useless. These are 1/2 inch or less diameter stickes with small leaves. I could not shred a cut up hedge! The chipper part only has one blade, so it is a slow and bumpy process. Poorly designed and vibrated from day one.
customer_reviews.author: RSL1

customer_reviews.title: Happy as a clam!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the electric Patriot because of my age. I wanted something I could handle and it did a great job. I was very pleased how quite it was and how powerful. This coming spring I intend to really give it a work out.
customer_reviews.author: bARBARA hOERNING

customer_reviews.title: Asked for refund!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with rust covered parts inside the chopping chamber. Directions for assembly have missing instructions for which screws to use to attach the leaf hopper etc., ended up with lots of spare screws without any idea what they're for. Used it once, it worked okay, but it spit out some 2-inch diameter branches like a two year child that doesn't like dinner! Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: k. david klein

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home use
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for home use. Feed slowly and quickly turn off if motor is overloaded to prevent triggering the circuit breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Jack S Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: So far so great!
customer_reviews.text: I still haven't used it yet, so I may update later, but surprisingly easy to put together after actually getting it out of the box. Getting it out of the box was rather difficult, but well worth the effort. The great packaging that made it difficult to get it out of the box also protected the machine beautifully during shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a shredder to mulch my small limbs and leaves in my backyard. This shredder is powerful and works very well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rickenbacher

customer_reviews.title: Seems well built
customer_reviews.text: Seems well built. Will update review after the chipper has been in use for a while.
customer_reviews.author: PatrickHenryPDX

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: It doesnt work well .It's expensive junk. I do not recommend this product. stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: had to return, not suitable for leaf mulching which was my reason for buying
customer_reviews.author: Fenton Scruggs

customer_reviews.title: Shipment error
customer_reviews.text: I order this item to my forwarder service in Miami, from there it was sent to me in Guatemala. Only one of two boxes arrived, so the apparatus was useless. After calling Amazon and explaining the situation a complete set of two boxes were sent and arrived, I am using the equipment and satisfied with it and the excellent response of Amazon!! Thank you,
customer_reviews.author: Rafael O. Cordon

customer_reviews.title: Patriot Elictric Wood Chipper/Shredder
customer_reviews.text: After using this shredder off an on for year now. I am not impressed with this shredder.It does have enough power and the motor is shot already.
customer_reviews.author: boiler

customer_reviews.title: Shredder clogged
customer_reviews.text: On first usage, the shredder clogged and stopped working. My fault for trying to shred wet leaves. Not sure how to un-clog without disassembly.
customer_reviews.author: Springfield Hokie

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't buy from Patriot if they were the last company that sold the product....
customer_reviews.author: T Wood

customer_reviews.title: ... to keep our yard tree cutting cleared up work good if you feed the tree cutting's in
customer_reviews.text: We moved to La Paz Mexico and use this to keep our yard tree cutting cleared up work good if you feed the tree cutting's in, one to two at a time
customer_reviews.author: William Henry Schaenzer

product_meta.title: Patriot Products CSV-2515 14 Amp Electric Wood Chipper/Leaf Shredder
product_meta.description:
Our most popular model! This Electric Chipper Shredder is the only one of its kind on the market today. Our unit will chip branches up to 2 1/2 inches in diameter. It is also ideal for shredding leaves. There are no hassles with gas or oil. It turns on with the flip of a switch. It can be used inside your garage, basement or hothouse. This workhorse has no ugly fumes. It plugs into your standard 110 volt outlet. You will need a good heavy-duty extension cord of less than 100 ft as this unit draws 14 amps of electricity. The electric chipper shredder weighs less than 100 pounds and comes with large wheels for easy transport around your home and yard. See for yourself why this valuable yard and garden tool received the National Home Gardening Club Member Tested Seal-of-Approval. We are also excited to report that in the summer of 2009 our electric chipper was rated a "Best Buy" by Consumers Digest magazine. This honor is given to less than 3% of the products tested and our chipper has received this honor for a FOURTH time. This unit comes complete with a 2-year warranty, a standard-size collection bag, and safety goggles. The Patriot Electric Chipper Shredder has a number of available accessories, SOLD SEPARATELY, designed specifically to improve your chipping and shredding experience. The Patriot 100 Ft Extension Cord guarantees to deliver the power you need; and when purchased with your New Patriot Electric Wood Chipper, your chipper's warranty is automatically extended one year. The Patriot Chipper Buddy provides a safe and easy way to help clear material from your wood chipper leaf shredder. The Patriot Gator Grabber makes easy work of feeding piles of leaves into the hopper, of your chipper shredder, without the need to bend over. The Patriot Jumbo Collection Bag holds twice the volume of the standard-size collection bag, so you can shred more leaves before you need to empty the bag.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
If you're in the market for serious lawn equipment for homeowners and professionals alike, you've come to the right place. At Patriot Products, we specialize in delivering the best machines at highly competitive prices. Our extensive line of lawn and garden tools is designed to make tackling even the biggest of jobs a breeze. Patriot Products in an American company that specializes in providing top-of-the-line lawn maintenance equipment. This Electric Chipper Shredder is the only one of its kind on the market today. Our unit will chip branches up to 2 1/2 inches in diameter. It is also ideal for shredding leaves. There are no hassles with gas or oil. It turns on with the flip of a switch. It can be used inside your garage, basement or hothouse. This workhorse has no ugly fumes. It plugs into your standard 110 volt outlet. You will need a good heavy-duty extension cord of less than 100 ft as this unit draws 14 amps of electricity. The electric chipper shredder weighs less than 100 pounds and comes with large wheels for easy transport around your home and yard. See for yourself why this valuable yard and garden tool received the National Home Gardening Club Member Tested Seal-of-Approval. We are also excited to report that in the summer of 2009 our electric chipper was rated a "Best Buy" by Consumers Digest magazine. This honor is given to less than 3% of the products tested and our chipper has received this honor for a SECOND time. This unit comes complete with a 2-year warranty, a collection bag, and safety goggles.
feature_bullets: Purchase Patriot's Electric Cord now and EXTEND YOUR CHIPPER’S WARRANTY ONE YEAR.
The quiet, smooth, maintenance free electric motor starts with just the flip of a switch.
Easily shred mountains of leaves by sliding them into the large hopper on the top of the unit.
The Patriot will make coin-sized chips out of branches up to 2 1/2 inches in diameter.
All processed material will discharge out the side of the machine into the standard collection bag.
